thread.title: Braless Toni Garrn joins Petra Nemcova, Adriana Lima and Stella Maxwell at Vanity Fair Oscars bash as the models ... - Daily Mail
thread.title_full: Braless Toni Garrn joins Petra Nemcova, Adriana Lima and Stella Maxwell at Vanity Fair Oscars bash as the models ... - Daily Mail

title: Braless Toni Garrn joins Petra Nemcova, Adriana Lima and Stella Maxwell at Vanity Fair Oscars bash as the models ... - Daily Mail

organizations.name: academy of motion picture arts and sciences

text: Buy now Victoria's Secret model Stella Maxwell also dazzled in metallics, as she wowed in a forest green gown adorned with heavy sequin embellishment that drew attention to her svelte frame. Adding to the glamour, the blonde bombshell's gown featured cut out detailing on the side, offering a look at her tiny waist as she paraded up and down the carpet posing for snaps. Her honey hued locks were slicked away from her flawless features, with loose waves cascading down her shoulders and exposing a pair of diamond drop earrings that added even more glamour to her ensemble. Gorgeous in green: Victoria's Secret model Stella Maxwell also dazzled in metallics, as she wowed in a forest green gown adorned with heavy sequin embellishment that drew attention to her svelte frame The atmosphere at the after party was no doubt one of complete shock, after the Oscars ceremony ended with Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway wrongly announcing La La Land as the winner of Best Picture, rather than the triumphant Moonlight. In a heart-stopping moment, the stars and producers of La La Land were stopped midway through their acceptance speeches and forced to hand their trophies to the stars of Moonlight. The terrible end to an otherwise triumphant show left the audience gasping in horror as Beatty revealed he had incorrectly read La La Land as the winner. Blue-tiful! Joan Smalls sizzled in a cobalt off the shoulder gown with a thigh high central split that flashed her lean legs Legs eleven! Also rocking a thigh high split was Chanel Iman, who dazzled in a strapless blue gown with diamond detailing Lacy lady: Nina Agdal sizzled in a lace adorned blue gown with mesh detailing that offered a look at her cleavage The unbelievable mishap came at the end of an otherwise flawless evening, which saw Casey Affleck and Emma Stone take home their first Oscar. Affleck won Best Actor for Manchester By The Sea, while Stone was crowned Best Actress for her work in La La Land. Just before that, Damien Chazelle won Best Director for La La Land. The musical had already won four other gongs at the event held at the Dolby Theater. It is already tied for most-nominations of all time and swept the original music categories as well as Best Production Design and Cinematography. A dream in cream: Baywatch babe Kelly Rohrbach proved that less is more in a strapless column gown which clung to her phenomenal physique, whilst a pair of gold hooped earrings was her chosen jewellery on the evening Fringe benefits! Victoria's Secret model Jasmine Tookes wowed in a black gown which featured sheer panels and fringing Hell for leather! Sara Sampaio sizzled in a black strapless gown with a dramatic full train and sequinned skirt Before Chazelle's win, Viola Davis took home her first-ever Oscar when she was crowned Best Supporting Actress for her role in Fences. The 51-year-old star gave an impassioned speech about being an actress at the event held at the Dolby Theater in Hollywood on Sunday night. Viola had tears in her eyes as she said: 'I became an artist, and thank God I did, because we are the only profession that celebrates what it means to live a life.' It was also a crowning achievement as she became the first black actor to ever receive an Oscar, Emmy, and a Tony. Radiant in red: Alessandra Ambrosio flaunted her phenomenal physique in a scarlet satin gown with a high split and plunging neckline that ensured all eyes would firmly be on her during the evening Sheer delight! Australian model Shanina Shaik showed off her incredible figure in a black beaded gown with sheer panels Earlier in the night, Mahershala Ali took home the gong for Best Supporting Actor for his role in Moonlight . The 43-year-old Oakland, California, native made sure to button up his tuxedo as he said his grandmother would tell him to do so. Ali had a very poignant moment during his speech as he talked about being an actor by explaining: 'It's not about you, it's about these characters, you are a servant.' The directors of Zootopia proudly accepted the Best Animated Feature Film gong. One even got political during the acceptance speech as they talked about the theme of the movie as they said: 'Zootopia is a story of tolerance being more powerful than fear of the other.' Scarlet siren: Karlie Kloss sizzled in a sequinned red gown that clung to her figure and featured off the shoulder detailing Bird of paradise: Heidi Klum looked phenomenal in a black gown adorned with a host of feathers on the skirt and bust The ceremony was kicked off by an entertaining performance by Justin Timberlake as sang his Trolls hit Can't Stop The Feeling. Then came out host Jimmy Kimmel, who immediately started joking about the state of the United States before poking fun at Mel Gibson and saying he's going to bury the hatchet with Matt Damon. The women of Hidden Figures - Taraji P Henson, Janelle Monáe, and Octavia Spencer - presented Best Documentary Feature to director Ezra Edelman, who dedicated his win for OJ: Made in America to Nicole Brown and Ron Goldman. Fit for a princess: Miranda Kerr was a vision of beauty in a baby blue gown adorned with diamand and crystal detailing and a dramatic full skirt that she couldn't resist playing around with as she posed for snaps Silver starlet: Rosie Huntington-Whiteley dressed her baby bump in a clinging silver satin gown as she cuddled up to fiance Jason Statham at the star-studded party Best Foreign Language Film was won by The Salesman, but director Asghar Farhadi chose not to come due to the 'travel ban'. He had a statement delivered on his behalf. Suicide Squad was a winner in the Best Make-Up And Hairstyling as Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them won Costume Design. Sci-fi thriller Arrival was given Best Sound Editing and Hacksaw Ridge was awarded in the Sound Mixing category. The annual awards ceremony hosted by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences recognizes excellence in cinematic achievements in the film industry as assessed by the Academy's voting membership. 89TH ACADEMY AWARDS WINNERS MOTION PICTURE OF THE YEAR Arrival
